medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, vomiting, dark urine, and altered mental status.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual, good state of health until symptoms began approximately 3 days prior to admission. Initially, she experienced severe nausea and vomiting that resolved after 24 hours. Following this, she developed progressive confusion, dark urine, and anorexia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), Hyperlipidemia (HL), mild dementia, right knee replacement.
